title: In-Depth Music Theory and Mathematical Structure Analysis Course Using Blended Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic music theory, music notation reading ability, and foundational mathematical knowledge in fractions/ratio calculations
context.additional_context: Aims to strengthen job competencies through advanced theoretical education for current music practitioners. Particularly designs education combining acoustic engineering calculations (e.g., frequency analysis, rhythm cycle measurement) with mathematical modeling capabilities.

learning_goals: Analyze harmonic structures (e.g., 3:5:8 frequency ratios) with 80% accuracy using music theory terminology and mathematical ratio calculations.

Learners can generate three types of 8-bit/16-bit rhythm patterns using interactive audio-visual content (e.g., rhythm generation software) in the LMS and achieve ≥3/4 points on a peer evaluation rubric (calculation accuracy, creativity, technical completeness).
Correct mathematical errors in harmonic progressions (e.g., periodicity violations, ratio mismatches) with ≥90% accuracy through online formative assessments.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
